column1: Gheorgheni (Romanian pronunciation: [ɡe̯orˈɡenʲ]; Hungarian: Gyergyószentmiklós Hungarian pronunciation: [ˈɟɛrɟoːsɛntmikloːʃ] (listen)) is a municipality in Harghita County
It lies in the Székely Land
column2: an ethno-cultural region in eastern Transylvania. The city administers four villages:

column1: Visafolio / VisszafolyóNearby are two natural sites
column2: the Red Lake and Cheile Bicazului
column3: a narrow canyon through the Eastern Carpathian Mountains forming the border with Neamț County.

column1: The city historically formed part of the Székely Land region of Transylvania. It was first mentioned in 1332.  It belonged to the Kingdom of Hungary with several interruptions
column2: the Eastern Hungarian Kingdom and the Principality of Transylvania
column3: administratively the town belonged to Gyergyószék. Between 1867–1918 it fell within Csík County
column4: in the Kingdom of Hungary. After World War I
column5: by the terms of the Treaty of Trianon of 1920
column6: it became part of Romania and fell within Ciuc County. Since 1940
column7: as a result of the Second Vienna Award
column8: it belonged to Hungary again. After World War II
column9: it became part of Romania. Between 1952 and 1960
column10: it formed part of the Magyar Autonomous Region
column12: of the Mureș-Hungarian Autonomous Region until it was abolished in 1968. Since then
column13: the commune is part of Harghita County.
